question.text: For the classification of angiosperms, floral characters are preferred over vegetative characters because:

options.text: The reproductive axis shows a large degree of prominent variations.
Floral characters show fewer variations than vegetative traits.
The shape of the flower is a diagnostic feature in many families.
Flower character is more prominent than vegetative characters.

solution.text: The floral characters tell us about the flowers and its arrangement, the floral organs and its fusion, on the other hand, the vegetative characters involve the shoot system and the roots. For classification of angiosperms, the floral characters are preferred over the vegetative characters because they are less affected by the external environment and therefore show fewer variations as compared to the vegetative traits of the plant. One more reason for their preference is that the flowers are easy to be carried and greatly vary from each other, which makes the classification easier.
